content.description:
The crux is at the start. Move up (usually left and up since the orange slab at the bottom is slick) to the "woogedy" (short jagged crack). Then move up the face to the top of the buttress and continue on easier climbing to the top.

The woogedy should take some good pro, as long as you leave room for your hands and feet.

This is usually done on top-rope after leading the 5.3 corner.
content.protection: Standard trad rack, with perhaps a #9 hex for the chunky bulges halfway up.
content.location: This is the lightning-bolt shaped crack on the buttress between the 5.3 corner and Dark in Bad.

content.description: This fun lead starts on Wasp Flake, but heads straight up where Wasp Flake continues left at the top of the ramp. The crux is the face climb just above the ramp to the first ledge on the right above the roof (see Mist).
content.protection: Pro is standard NC rack, and very available. Use a tree at the top.
content.location:
This climb follows Wasp Flake to the top of the ramp. At the top, head straight up the left side of the large flake. Above the flake, angle right and up between the munge and grass to the top.

This can be done as a single pitch, but communication will be a challenge. Don't belay from the first ledge above the flake and roof, because it is home to a large nest of hungry ants.

You can top-rope either with belay from the top, or rappel from a tree at the top to the 1st pitch belay ledge and set gear to belay from the bottom.

content.description:
This climb leads up the face right of the Wasp Flake ramp to a notch in the shallow roof above. The roof, or the face just below it, is the crux.

An alternate is to head left above the ramp to the right side of the large flake and then straight up left of the roof. Top out the same as for Scrambled Brains.
content.protection: Solid pro throughout with a standard NC rack. You can drop a large hex behind the flake for a bomber hold there, or protect the roof move with a tri-cam.
content.location: Start just right of the Wasp Flake ramp, or step up to the bottom of the flake and then right onto the face. Follow the face left and up to the notch in the roof. Climbing is much easier above the roof.

content.description: This is an arched corner/crack to the right of the buttress that dominates the left side of the main wall. The crux is the first couple of moves, and then there is a bit of 5.6ish face above the ledge.
content.protection: Trad pro is sparse. This is usually done on top-rope after leading the 5.3 up the left corner of the buttress.
content.location: From Freddie's Dead step right of the buttress to a short arching seam before the odd bow-tie shaped feature (alternate start?). Lead up the arch to the shallow ledge, then up and left on the face to or just right of the chunky weakness below the upper ledge of the leftward climbs. Make your way to the top from there.

content.description:
The route starts below a left facing corner and follows the inside of the corner up to a set of double bolts. There are ample opportunities to place gear along the way. At the end of the corner, climb the face up to the anchors. The route can be ended here.  Or, clip the anchors, and head straight up another short, steep wall to the top of the rock and belay using a tree. If straight up seems daunting, then head up and left to a tree belay.

Rappel from the dual anchors if not climbing the route to the top. Or if finishing the route rap off of a tree down to the anchors and finish rappelling using the anchors. You can also walk off left from the top.
content.location: Far right of wall. Base of climb well shaded by tree cover.

content.protection: Climb Bookends and string the rope through the rings to top rope this route, which is just to the left of Bookends. The further left from Bookends you venture, the harder the climb.
